intro: Geranium robertianum subvar. modestum, commonly known as the lesser geranium, is a low-growing perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features upright stems with opposite, palmately lobed leaves that are typically hairy and have a distinctive heart-shaped base. The plant produces small, clustered flowers in shades of pink or red, which bloom from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its foliage and flowers are often used in traditional herbal medicine for their purported diuretic and antiseptic properties.
